description:
Whitecross Estate (various locations - see site plan)

(T1 - T5) London plane x5 - Reduce crowns to most recent and outermost pruning points removing approximately 2.5 metres branch length.  Inspect crown from a climbed position to check for and remove any limbs affected by Massaria disease. 
(T6) Norway maple - Remove regrowth formed since most recent reduction
(T7) Tulip tree - Remove regrowth formed since most recent reduction / Remove dead or defective low limbs
(G8) Amelanchier (group) - 2-3 small trees with dead or defective stems observed Remove dead/dying stems
(T10) Ash - Reduce crown overall by 2-3m
(G11) Amelanchier (group) - Small trees with dead or defective stems observed - Remove dead/dying stems
(T12) Amelanchier - Remove deadwood from crown
(T13 Amelanchier 2 13(at base) SM 4 Peabody Condition of tree, as with other trees of this species within area, is declining when compared to last inspection. Reassess next phase with a view to replacing these trees Remove deadwood from crown
(T14) Dead - Remove young tree including stump, stake and ties
(T16) Amelanchier - Cut back from building to clear by a minimum of 1m
(T22) Amelanchier - Remove young tree including stump, stake and ties
(T26) Amelanchier (Lower half of trunk obscured by holly hedge) - Deadwood and twisted, crossing branches. Crown thin 10% (including removal of deadwood)
(T29) Amelanchier - Young tree maintenance
(T30) Liquidambar - Remove regrowth formed since most recent reduction
(T32) Catalpa - Selectively reduce laterals by 1-1.5m over market stalls to alleviate overhang
(T33) Catalpa - Selectively reduce laterals by 1-1.5m over market stalls to alleviate overhang
